items.content_html:
This PR updates and corrects the real values for Firefox and Firefox Android for the CredentialsContainer API, based upon results from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v6.0.1).

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.appspot.com/tests/api/CredentialsContainer

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.

items.content_html:
This PR adds real values for Opera and Opera Android for the reason member of the AbortSignal API, based upon results from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v6.0.1). The collector obtains results based upon Opera Desktop 12.16 and 15, as well as the latest version of Opera Desktop and Opera Android. Version numbers are then copied for Blink-based Opera versions from Chrome Desktop and Android respectively.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.appspot.com/tests/api/AbortSignal/reason

Check out the collector's guide on how to review this PR.
items.title: Add Opera versions for api.AbortSignal.reason

items.title: Add Safari versions for AbortSignal API

items.content_html:
1. This adds support for WebAssembly:Exception.stack, and constructor WebAssembly:Exception constructor option option.traceStack.

    • These are NOT in the spec yet but they are in the explainer, they are intended to go into the spec and they have been implemented in Firefox, Chromium, node, and probably Safari
    • Because they are not in the spec I indicated non-standard - but perhaps I should just put as standard since things are heading that way? I decided not to so that I can add the spec link later when one exists.

  2. Support was added for this in chromium was added in version 95 : https://chromestatus.com/feature/4756734233018368

  3. Support was added in node for v8 9.5 which corresponds to v17.0.0 : https://v8.dev/blog/v8-release-95#webassembly
items.title: WebAssembly:Exception.stack and `option.traceStack` and platform support

items.content_html:
Summary

Mark mozPreservesPitch as deprecated, add support information for unprefixed preservesPitch.

Test results and supporting details

Updated tests + checked results as per Bug 1652950.

Related issues

Bug 1652950 (Complete) - Unprefix mozPreservesPitch and update related tests.
Bug 1765201 (Future work) - Remove support for deprecated mozPreservesPitch.
items.title: Add Firefox support for unprefixed preservesPitch

items.content_html: This PR removes all of the remaining Firefox Android flag data from BCD that isn't already covered by other PRs, as well as similar Firefox desktop flag data.
items.title: Remove remaining Firefox Android flags + old Firefox desktop flags

items.content_html:
Summary

Adds support data for secure context required in battery status.

Test results and supporting details

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/w80tJL8uEV8 - Intent to Deprecate and Remove confirming version 103.

w3c/battery#51 - MR to add requirement to spec

https://chromestatus.com/roadmap#:~:text=LATER-,Chrome%20103,-Beta%20coming%20May - Chrome 103 release date
items.title: Mark Battery Status API as requiring secure context from Chrome 103

items.content_html:
These IDL attributes were renamed in the spec:
WICG/priority-hints#71

However, they remain all-camelcase in Chromium and are about to be
released in Chrome 101, so capture that in the data.

Also mark all of this experimental, per guidelines:
https://github.com/mdn/browser-compat-data/blob/main/docs/data-guidelines.md#choosing-an-experimental-status
items.title: Rename fetchpriority properties to fetchPriority

items.content_html:
This was added in #14090
but appears to have been a mistake or bug.

The now-removed test for this was simple:

(function() {
  var instance = navigator;
  return 'fonts' in instance;
})();

However, the test results from v4.0.0 of the collector are all false:
https://github.com/foolip/mdn-bcd-results/tree/1b5607ce99aff7d11bc07134e382930ad83436f5

This was determined by looking at "api.WorkerNavigator.fonts" in the
results, in particular for Chrome 69 and Safari 15, but there's not a
single true test result among the results.

It's unclear what went wrong, but this isn't supported, and never was.

This was removed from the spec here:
WICG/local-font-access#70

This is the only instance of "local-font-access" in BCD so no other bits
of the API were added, at least not with spec URLs.
items.title: Remove non-standard and unsupported api.WorkerNavigator.fonts
